title: Enhancing Practical System Design Competencies: Academic Load Management Strategies in Online Learning Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: Practical Competency Enhancement Program for IT/Software Development Professionals

learning_goals: Learners can reduce academic workload by over 20% when designing math projects by applying the six stages of the LATARE framework: goal setting, activity design, material development, assessment planning, implementation, and evaluation
Learners can improve time management efficiency by 30% during project periods using weekly study planners and digital calendar tools
Learners can identify at least three academic workload factors occurring during actual project execution through peer feedback and instructor coaching and propose solutions
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
